intro: Mimulopsis hildebrandtii, commonly known as the Hildebrandt's mimulus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Limnanthaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant has a short life cycle, often completing its growth and reproduction within a single growing season. It prefers moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and streambanks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
